mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter: Jane C. Washington, Blakeley, to John Augustine Washington, 1837 December 22
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Jane Charlotte Blackburn, 1786-1855
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Janes writes that she is sending down "four large shoulder of Bacon" to Mount Vernon, along with two enslaved men, Willoughby and Gabriel, who she hopes will be "faithful & useful." She writes, "have them comfortably fixed my dear son treat them kindly, & I trust they will both prove valuable servants. Gabriel will require a strict tho kind discipline. Sarah or Milly must wast & mend for them." Jane also writes that she has had a letter from West Ford asking for the money she owes him. She instructs John Augustine to pay her pew fee and then pay Ford. Autograph letter intialed, 2 pages.
